original_context: Reflection on the stress of Waterloo ECE 'Hell Week' midterms and the realization that consistent studying is the key to exponential growth.\
generated_post_text:
My best friends are balding.

Are they really? Yes. (ECE midterms are lethal, (unless you genuinely love it or are insanely cracked, donâ€™t take it). I think itâ€™s the water + stress to be honest.

Stress? Oh yeah.

Waterloo Engineering had itâ€™s infamous â€œHell Weekâ€, a week full of back-to-back midterms.

Was it hard? Yeah!
Did we get through it? Yeah!

High stakes, and no breaks.

Thatâ€™s what it was. It felt like no matter how much I studied, no matter how good or poor an exam went, you had to just forget about it, and move on to the next one.

But what did I learn?
Consistently studying is the way to do well on these exams.

Cramming can scrape a pass, but in this week, I learned so much that if I studied this hard every week, the growth and learning is what is truly is exponential.

This is why I will start studying hard much more consistently. Why? Because that anxiety and panic of LEARNING content the day before an exam is a feeling I never want to have again.\

original_context: Analogy between a friend's mass DM dating strategy and the 'ship first, refine later' approach to product development, emphasizing speed over perfection.\

so instead of building himself and waiting for the right one,

no testing, just raw market execution.

instead of waiting around, he got in a relationship, 
and then became a good boyfriend
